content: During the 1920s, when prohibition was in full swing, what was the most popular liquor being made illegally within the United States and what was the most popular liquor to be smuggled into the country?

chosen: The most popular illegal alcohol during Prohibition (the years of 1920-33) were bathtub gin and Canadian whiskey. Bathtub Gin is a homemade form of distilled spirits that can easily be produced at home using household ingredients such as rubbing alcohol or vodka.
rejected: The most popular illegal alcohol during Prohibition era (1920-33) were homemade whiskey or moonshine. The reason for its popularity is that it's easy to make at home with simple ingredients such as corn meal mash, yeast, water, sugar etc., which are readily available even under strict alcoholic laws.
